haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
None is travelling
Here along this way but I,
This autumn evening.

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
An old pond
A frog jumps in -
Splash!

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Old dark sleepy pool... 
quick unexpected
frog
Goes plop! Watersplash!

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Lightening -
Heron's cry
Stabs the darkness

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Clouds come from time to time -
and bring to men a chance to rest
from looking at the moon.

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
In the cicada's cry
There's no sign that can foretell
How soon it must die.

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Poverty's child -
he starts to grind the rice,
and gazes at the moon.

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Won't you come and see
loneliness? Just one leaf
from the kiri tree.

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Temple bells die out.
The fragrant blossoms remain.
A perfect evening!

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Ballet in the air ...
twin butterflies
until, twice white
They meet, they mate

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Black cloudbank broken
scatters in the
night ... Now see
Moon-lighted mountains!

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Seek on high bare trails
sky-reflecting
violets...
Mountain-top jewels

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
For a lovely bowl
let us arrange these
flowers...
Since there is no rice

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Now that eyes of hawks
in dusky night
are darkened... 
Chirping of the quails

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
April's air stirs in
willow-leaves... 
a butterfly
Floats and balances

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
In the sea-surf edge
mingling with
bright small shells ..
Bush-clover petals

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
The river
Gathering may rains
from cold streamlets
for the sea... 
Murmuring Mogami

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
White cloud of mist
above white
cherry-blossoms... 
Dawn-shining mountains

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Twilight whippoorwill... 
whistle on,
sweet deepener
Of dark loneliness

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Mountain-rose petals
falling, falling,
falling now... 
Waterfall music

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Ah me! I am one
who spends his little
breakfast
Morning-glory gazing

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Seas are wild tonight... 
stretching over
Sado Island
Silent clouds of stars

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Why so scrawny, cat?
starving for fat fish
or mice... 
Or backyard love?

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Dewdrop, let me cleanse
in your brief
sweet waters... 
These dark hands of life

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Glorious the moon... 
therefore our thanks
dark clouds
Come to rest our necks

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Under cherry-trees
soup, the salad,
fish and all... 
Seasoned with petals

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Too curious flower
watching us pass,
met death... 
Our hungry donkey

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Cloud of cherry-bloom... 
tolling twilight
bell...  Temple
Ueno? Asakura?

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Must springtime fade?
then cry all birds... 
and fishes
Cold pale eyes pour tears

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Such utter silence!
even the crickets'
singing... 
Muffled by hot rocks

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Swallow in the dusk... 
spare my little
buzzing friends
Among the flowers

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Reply:
Bright red pepper-pod... 
it needs but shiny
wings and look... 
Darting dragon-fly!

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Wake! The sky is light!
let us to the road
again... 
Companion butterfly!

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Silent the old town... 
the scent of flowers
floating... 
And evening bell

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Camellia-petal
fell in silent dawn... 
spilling
A water-jewel

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
In the twilight rain
these brilliant-hued
hibiscus... 
A lovely sunset

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Lady butterfly
perfumes her wings
by floating
Over the orchid

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Now the swinging bridge
is quieted
with creepers... 
Like our tendrilled life

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
The sea darkening... 
oh voices of the
wild ducks
Crying, whirling, white

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Nine times arising
to see the moon... 
whose solemn pace
Marks only midnight yet

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Here, where a thousand
captains swore grand
conquest...  Tall
Grass their monument

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Now in sad autumn
as I take my
darkening path... 
A solitary bird

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Will we meet again
here at your
flowering grave... 
Two white butterflies?

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Dry cheerful cricket
chirping, keeps
the autumn gay... 
Contemptuous of frost

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
First white snow of fall
just enough to bend
the leaves
Of faded daffodils

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Carven gods long gone... 
dead leaves alone
foregather
On the temple porch

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Cold first winter rain... 
poor monkey,
you too could use
A little woven cape

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
No oil to read by... 
I am off to bed
but ah!... 
My moonlit pillow

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
This snowy morning
that black crow
I hate so much... 
But he's beautiful!

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
If there were fragrance
these heavy snow-
flakes settling... 
Lilies on the rocks

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
See: surviving suns
visit the ancestral
grave... 
Bearded, with bent canes

haikus.author: Matsuo Basho
haikus.haiku:
Death-song:
Fever-felled half-way,
my dreams arose
To march again... 
Into a hollow land

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Standing still at dusk
listen...  In far
distances
The song of froglings!

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
My two plum trees are
so gracious... 
see, they flower
One now, one later

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
The laden wagon runs
bumbling and creaking
down the road... 
Three peonies tremble

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Lightning flash, crash... 
waiting in the
bamboo grove
See three dew-drops fall

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Afternoon shower... 
walking and talking
in the street:
Umbrella and raincoat!

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Sadness at twilight... 
villain! I have
let my hand
Cut that peony

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
In dim dusk and scent
a witness
now half hidden... 
Evenfall orchid

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Voices of two bells
that speak from
twilight temples... 
Ah! Cool dialogue

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Deep in dark forest
a woodcutter's
dull axe talking... 
And a woodcutter

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Butterfly asleep
folded soft on
temple bell... 
Then bronze gong rang!

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
See the morning breeze
ruffling his so
silky hair... 
Cool caterpillar

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
A camellia
dropped down into
still waters
Of a deep dark well

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
In the holy dusk
nightingales begin
their psalm... 
Good! The dinner-gong!

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
A short summer night... 
but in this solemn
darkness
One peony bloomed

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Pebbles shining clear,
and clear
six silent fishes... 
Deep autumn water

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
A bright autumn moon... 
in the shadow of
each grass
An insect chirping

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
White chrysanthemum... 
before that
perfect flower
Scissors hesitate

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
At furue in rain
gray water and
grey sand... 
Picture without lines

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
The old fisherman
unalterably
intent... 
Cold evening rain

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Rainy-month, dripping
on and on
as I lie abed... 
Ah, old man's memories!

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Slanting lines of rain... 
on the dusty
samisen
A mouse is trotting

haikus.author: Yosa Buson
haikus.haiku:
Old weary willows... 
I thought how long
the road would be
When you went away

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
A sudden shower falls -
and naked I am riding
on a naked horse.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Summer shower -
naked horse
a naked rider.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
A frog and I,
eyeball to eyeball.
My empty face,
betrayed by lightening.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Cool breeze,
tangled
in a grass-blade.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Step by step
up a summer mountain -
suddenly: the sea.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Cries of wild geese,
rumors spread about me.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Stillness -
clouds peak
in the lake.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Just by being,
I'm here -
in the snow-fall.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Showering
onto Mount Kiso,
the Milky Way.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
What a moon -
if only my grumbling wife
were here.

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
In this windy nest
open your hungry
mouth in vain... 
Issa, stepchild bird

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
On the death of his child:
Dew evaporates
and all our world
is dew...  So dear,
So fresh, so fleeting

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
A gate made all of twigs
With woven grass
For hinges... 
For a lock...  This snail

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Arise from sleep, old cat,
and with great yawns
and stretchings... 
Amble out for love

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Hi! My little hut
is newly-thatched
I see... 
Blue morning-glories

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Dim the grey cow comes
mooing mooing
and mooing
Out of the morning mist

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
What a peony... 
demanding to be
measured
By my little fan!

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
A nursemaid scarecrow... 
frightening the
wind and sun
From playing baby

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
A saddening world:
flowers whose sweet
blooms must fall... 
As we too, alas...

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Hi! Kids mimicking
cormorants...  You are
more like
Real cormorants than
They!

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Over the mountain
bright the full white
moon now smiles... 
On the flower-thief

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Good friend grasshopper
will you play
the caretaker
For my little grave?

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Giddy grasshopper
take care...  Do not
leap and crush
These pearls of dewdrop

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Now be a good boy
take good care of
our house... 
Cricket my child

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Good evening breeze!
crooked and
meandering
Your homeward journey

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
The turnip farmer rose
and with a fresh-
pulled turnip... 
Pointed to my road

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
I am going out... 
be good and play
together
My cricket children

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
If strangers threaten
turn into fat
green bullfrogs... 
Pond-cooling melons

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Live in simple faith... 
just as this
trusting cherry
Flowers, fades, and falls

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Oh do not swat them... 
unhappy flies
forever
Wringing their thin hands

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
In the city fields
contemplating
cherry-trees... 
Strangers are like friends

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Yellow autumn moon... 
unimpressed
the scarecrow stands
Simply looking bored

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Cruel autumn wind
cutting to the
very bones... 
Of my poor scarecrow

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
I must turn over... 
beware of local
earthquakes
Bedfellow cricket!

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Visiting the graves... 
trotting on to show
the way... 
Old family dog

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Before boiled chestnuts
cross-legged lad
is squatting... 
Carved wooden Buddha

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Nice: wild persimmons... 
and notice how
the mother
Eats the bitter parts

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
What a gorgeous one
that fat sleek huge
old chestnut
I could not get at...

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Oh former renter
I know it all, all... 
down to
The very cold you felt

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Plume of pampas grass
trembling
in every wind... 
Hush, my lonely heart

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Considerate dogs... 
stepping off
into the snow
As I walk the path

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
Buddha on the hill... 
from your holy
nose indeed
Hangs an icicle

haikus.author: Kobayashi Issa
haikus.haiku:
The orphan speaks:
the year-end party... 
I am even envious
Of scolded children
